body.name: Cut from the Same Western Cloth: A Historical Western Romance Novel

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic hit from Leslie Hales!
reviews.reviewText: I read this in one day, since I couldn't put it down! Fantastic book, so exciting and interesting, with strong unique characters, and a storyline that keeps you in its grip. A very wealthy family in San Francisco has twin babies, both girls, each with her own nanny. But the parents ignore the babies, and one of the nannies tries to get the mother to show one of the girls love and gets fired. She cannot bear to leave the girl with such an unfeeling uncaring mother, so she takes the child with her, raising her as her own. Now the twins are 19, and the taken girl, "Alice", finds out what happened, after her "mother" has died. She seeks answers and the truth. Henry Williams is a wealthy doctor, as is his father, and is expected to take over the practice, as well as marry the wealthy Cora (Alice's twin). But Henry just wants to go to a small town where he is much needed and can personally know everyone he is helping. So many twists, this is a fast fun read!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars How would you feel to learn you had a twin?
reviews.reviewText: Alice's mother passing away from a couple years of illness when she is 19 and then she learns of her true heritage. Her "Papa" has to share with her that neither parent she has known are her actual birth parents. Her mother was her nanny and kidnapped her rather than be separated from her when she was fired. Her twin sister had another nanny as her family was very wealthy. Their mother was very hands-off and image is everything to her (then and still is, as Alice learns later).Alice finds where her parents and sister are, moves there for a time to try to meet them. She determines this needs to be cautiously approached but then meets her twin. There is an immediate bond and a big request from her. Alice is uncertain but decides to do what her twin asks although there are many potential pitfalls. I leave the rest for you to read - a delightful story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars AGAINST ALL ODDS
reviews.reviewText: Wonderful, heartwarming old Western romance story with lots of events to keep a reader interested. Alice is from Riverstone, Oregon. Alice is reared in a loving caring home. She learns when she is 19 years old that the people that she thought were her parents are not. Mr. Miller gives Alice a letter written by his wife, Luisa, before her death and his wife’s diary. Now, Alice is on the hunt for her birth parents that she travels to San Francisco. Unknown to Alice, she has a twin sister, Cora that she meets at seamstress shop where Alice is working. Cora basically asks Alice to switch places, to leave Alice an obligation to learn of her real parents in their environment. Meanwhile, Cora is free to pursue her own love interest that her parents condemn and forcefully control her movements to contain her efforts. Henry Williams is the one chosen by both sets of parents to wed Cora, but he is not interested Cora. Alice learns from Luisa Miller’s diary that she played with Henry William when she was a young age before Alice left New York City with Luisa. Henry’s statement on their wedding day “It only makes me more convinced that we were destined to be with one another no matter what. See how we’ve managed to find each other against all odds.” Need to read story for all the details and how Cora’s romance comes to fruition.Received ARC copy review is voluntary, Thank you Leslie Hales

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars WOW! Amazing, great Story!!!
reviews.reviewText: Any story that I have ever read by Leslie Hales has always been a riveting tale, but she has outdone herself with this one!!! Alice Miller's Mother passes away leaving behind a letter for her letting her know that the life she has been living isn't the one she was born to! She was kidnapped as an infant!! She decides to go to San Francisco to see if she can discover who she truly is. That is the first of many plot twists!!! There is plenty of action, drama, mystery, romance and so much more in this very well written historical Western!!She discovers an identical twin sister and they switch places. Will Cora's beau, Henry Williams, realize that he is now dating Alice instead of Cora? Once you start this one, you will not want to put it down!! The characters are fantastic, well introduced, and developed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I have never read anything by Leslie Hales before, OMG this is fantastic!! Alice's Mother died five years ago, she had left a letter and a journal for Alice. It had been up to her dad when to give it to her, it was something that would change her life. Alice finds out she has a twin sister, and that her mom is not her biological mom!! Alice wants to go meet her twin sister (Cora), and her biological parents. Is it all she's hoped for? Does she regret meeting them? Love the plot, great setting, and strong intense interesting characters. I look forward to reading more from Leslie Hales!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Wonderful story full of love, intrigue and family. I especially liked when the sisters meet and are able to form a bond and a plan for each of them to get their wish. Alice gets to meet her birth parents and Cora gets to be with the man she loves. Now the drama begins. I was unable to put my Kindle down. I recommend this book to you all. Enjoy !!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a very interesting story. I had a bit of difficulty getting into it at first, but it is WELL worth the time to continue reading! The characters are intriguing and interesting to follow. I truly enjoyed reading this story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a wonderful western mainly based in San Francisco. This is an enchanting story of a girl who learned nothing in her life is what she thought and her adventures to see what she missed. Great story of love, family and as in all families miscommunication leading to an exciting end. Must read!
Highly recommend this book by a great author
